content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-201-02-A
|Item_parent=Organ transplants: epidemiological and immunological aspects; principles of treatment and monitoring; complications and prognosis; ethical and legal aspects. Organ procurement and legislation
|Item_parent_short=Organ transplants: epidemiological and immunological aspects; principles of treatment and monitoring; complications and prognosis; ethical and legal aspects. Organ procurement and legislation
|Rank=A
|Title=Know the definition of transplanted tissues and organs
|Description=None
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Dany Anglicheau
|Order=2}}

The different organs transplanted are :

*Rein
*Liver
*Heart
*Pancreas
*Lungs
*Intestines


Cell and tissue transplants can involve :

*Haematopoietic stem cells
*Cornea
*Amniotic membranes
*bones, tendons, ligaments, menisci
*Skin
*Heart valves, arteries and veins

question.question: What types of tissues can be transplanted through cell and tissue transplants?
question.option_a: Only organs such as the liver, heart, and lungs
question.option_b: Tissues such as cornea, amniotic membranes, bones, tendons, ligaments, menisci, and skin
question.option_c: Only haematopoietic stem cells and heart valves, arteries, and veins
question.option_d: All of the above options, including organs and tissues
